places.generalDescription: Bhatta Falls, situated about 10 km from Mussoorie in Uttarakhand, India, is a picturesque waterfall that offers a unique experience for visitors. To reach the highest point of the falls, one must trek and climb steps, adding an adventurous thrill to the visit. The cascade of water descends gently from the mountains into a serene pool below, creating a tranquil and photogenic setting that attracts nature lovers and adventure seekers alike.

sources.snippet: Situated on the Mussoorie-Dehradun road, at a distance of around 8 km from the hill station, Bhatta Falls makes an essential part of every Mussoorie tour. Popular for picnics, it is a man-made waterfall, which has been created by diverting water from a stream in Bhatta village. There is also a small freshwater pond where tourists can dip their feet or take baths.
sources.shortName: 20 Incredible Tourist Places to Visit in Mussoorie

sources.snippet: Bhatta Falls :Bhatta Falls is a capital tourist picnic place near the Mussoorie. Visitors like to bath with fun at the bhtta fall mussoorie.There is also a childern park with slopes,slides and swings for playing which makes this place beloved for both adults and childern. Bhatta Falls is one of the important place where we do lots of enjoy with natures.

The area of Bhatta Falls is blessed with a serene ambiance and has emerged as a frequented travel site. Hundreds of tourists swarm to Bhatta Falls to spend a relaxing one-day itinerary amidst nature.

places.name: Bhatta falls

reviews.text:
Bhatta Falls in Rishikesh is such a peaceful and underrated spot. Surrounded by pure greenery, the sound of water hitting the rocks just calms your mind instantly. The short walk to the falls is fun and totally worth it once you reach. Water is super clean and cold â€“ perfect for dipping your feet and just chilling for a bit.

Not too crowded, which makes the vibe even better. It's the kind of place where you just want to sit, relax, and enjoy nature in silence. For anyone looking to escape the usual chaos, this place is a gem.

Nothing much. If you want to have snacks lunch etc while your feet dipped into the cold waterfall water, this is the place for you.
I went here just to make my children experience the ropeway which is 250â‚¹ per head round trip.
Nice green plants for clicking few snaps. You can spend 1-2 hrs in peace.

Natural waterfall at Bhatta Falls. Scenic view.

You can enjoy with friends and family having bath and get hot snacks form the adjacent cafes.

Some cafes arrange for seating in the water flowing through the falls.

Efforts are required to keep the place clean.

NOTE: Please check the weather before you go. Avoid during rains as water flow can increase.

places.address: C3QF+39F, Bhatta Gaon, Mussoorie, Kyar Kuli Bhatta, Uttarakhand 248179, India

places.generalDescription: The Tibetan Buddhist Temple in Mussoorie offers a serene and tranquil retreat amidst the lush hills of this charming town. The temple commands stunning views of the surrounding valleys and majestic mountains, providing a breathtaking backdrop for spiritual reflection. The complex itself showcases a blend of traditional Tibetan and Japanese architectural influences, with a golden statue of Lord Buddha as its focal point exuding tranquility.

sources.snippet: In 1959, when the 14th Dalai Lama took refuge in Mussoorie, a lot Tibetans came along with him and later when the government moved them to Dharamshala a great community of Tibetans were left behind which further became an integral part influencing the culture of Mussoorie. Considering all these, the Tibetan Buddhist Temple was consecrated by the Dalai Lama. It was the 1st Tibetan shrine to be built in India.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Mussoorie: Photos, Timings & Highlights

sources.snippet: At a distance of 2.5 km from Library Bus Stand, Happy Valley is a large Tibetan settlement in Mussoorie. It is also famous for housing IAS Academy, Tibetan temples and the Municipal Gardens. Happy Valley starts from the west side of Library Point and leads to the Cloud's End.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Mussoorie, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

places.name: Tibetan Buddhist Temple

reviews.text: The Tibetan Buddhist Temple in Mussoorie is a peaceful haven tucked away in the hills, offering a quiet escape from the buzz of the town. The moment you step in, there's a sense of calm that surrounds you - perfect for just sitting in silence or soaking in the peaceful energy. The view from the nearby buddha statue on mountain top is absolutely breathtaking, with a 360-degree panorama of the surrounding mountain ranges that seem to stretch endlessly into the sky. When I visited, a small group was sitting nearby, softly playing the guitar, and it added such a warm, soulful vibe to the already serene atmosphere. It's the kind of place where you can pause, breathe, and just feel completely at peace.

Great place , very scenic .
Lord Buddha Statue so well built.
Small maggie points also there where one can sit , relax and enjoy snacks.
Panoramic view of mountain s.
Approx 500 m trek to reach there.

The view from hill top is scintillating. We felt fresh air and divinely. The path to reach the view point is scenic and 360 degrees picturesque view adds value for the time spend to climb the steps. One of the must visit spot to spend quality time with family.

places.generalDescription: Nestled at an elevation of 6000ft, Mussoorie is a popular hill station known for its religious sites and colonial heritage. Among the top attractions in Mussoorie is Company Garden, situated about 3 kilometers from Mall Road. This garden, also known as Company Bagh, was established by the local administration to boost tourism. It serves as an amusement park featuring approximately 800 species of vibrant flowers and various activities for children.

sources.snippet: The well-kept Company Garden is a display of natural beauty that provides fantastic photo opportunities with fountains and flowering bushes. The British colonial-style gardens are a visual pleasure since they provide a breathtaking perspective of the surrounding hills. There is a tacit arrangement to occupy your children while allowing you and your loved ones to spend precious time gazing at the hills.

places.name: Atal Udhyan Mussoorie

reviews.text:
Company Garden, also known as Municipal Garden, is a popular tourist attraction in Mussoorie, located about 3 km from the Mall Road. Nestled amidst lush greenery and scenic views of the hills, it offers a peaceful retreat for families, couples, and nature lovers alike.

The garden is well-maintained and features a beautiful collection of flowers, fountains, and trimmed lawns. One of its main highlights is the colorful flowerbeds that bloom vibrantly during the spring and summer months, creating a picturesque setting. There is also a small artificial waterfall and boating pond, which adds to the charm and provides a relaxing activity for visitors.

For those traveling with children, the garden has a mini amusement park with rides and activities that keep kids entertained. There are also several food stalls and a small market selling souvenirs, local handicrafts, and snacks. The entry fee is nominal, making it an affordable outing option.

Though it can get crowded during peak season, the overall ambiance remains pleasant. Visitors looking for a quieter experience may prefer to go early in the morning or on weekdays.

One drawback is that the place could benefit from better signage and maintenance in some areas. Despite this, Company Garden is still a worthwhile visit for anyone coming to Mussoorie, especially those who enjoy casual walks in nature and spending time outdoors.

In summary, Company Garden is a refreshing and family-friendly destination that adds charm to any Mussoorie itinerary.

This garden is truly beautiful and picture-perfect at every turn. The multi-level concept adds a unique charm.
From a beautiful flower garden to a small soothing waterfall, every corner feels like a breath of fresh air.

The place is extremely well maintained, and even the rule of not touching any flowers, not even the fallen ones, shows how much effort goes into preserving its beauty-and it's honestly a good rule to keep it maintained.

The garden also has a food court inside, a few shopping stalls for local finds, and photographer (paid basis) to capture your moments . Whether you're here with family or clicking photos for your feed, there's something for everyone.

Entry is â‚¹50 for both kids and adults, while little ones under 3 enter free. A peaceful, vibrant spot worth visiting!

Company Garden, also called Municipal Garden, is a popular picnic spot in Mussoorie, Uttarakhand. It is located about 3 km from Mall Road (Library Bazaar side) and is easy to reach by rickshaw, taxi, or even a pleasant walk.

The garden is well maintained with colorful flowers, green lawns, and fountains that make it look very lively. There is also a small artificial lake inside where you can enjoy boating, which is a favorite activity for families and kids. The garden has swings, a mini amusement park, and food stalls, so you can spend a few hours here relaxing and having fun.

Company Garden is about 6,000 feet above sea level, so the weather stays cool and fresh. The best time to visit is between March to June and September to November, when the flowers bloom beautifully and the climate is comfortable.

It is a great place for a family picnic, photography, or just a peaceful walk among nature. Since it is close to the main town, you don't need much travel time, making it one of the easiest and most enjoyable spots in Mussoorie.

places.address: F363+CJW, Mussoorie Rd, Malsi, Dehradun, Mussoorie, Uttarakhand 248009, India

places.generalDescription: Gun Hill, the second-highest point in Mussoorie, is a popular hilltop destination offering breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding area. Visitors can reach Gun Hill via an exhilarating cable car ride that provides a bird's eye view of the hills below. Alternatively, a bridle path branching off from Mall Road near kutchery offers a twenty-minute hike to the summit.

sources.snippet: Located at 2,024 meters above sea level, Gun Hill Point is one of the most famous viewpoints in Mussoorie city. It offers superb views across the Himalayan ranges and down over the Doon Valley. Many photographers visit this place because they want to show how the sky changes color both during sunset and sunrise while others are preoccupied with taking amazing shots that will include surrounding peaks and valleys.
sources.shortName: Must-Visit Places For Photography Enthusiasts To Capture Stunning Shots In Mussoorie

sources.snippet: Gun Hill, the second highest peak in Mussoorie at around 2024 metres, offers breathtaking views of the Doon Valley below and the majestic Himalayan range in the distance. It's a place steeped in history, particularly from the British colonial era. The hill's name originates from the time when a cannon was fired from its summit at midday to signal the time to Mussoorie's residents.

sources.snippet: One of the most well-known sites and scenic spots in Mussoorie, a well-liked hill resort in the Indian state of Uttarakhand, is Gun Hill. Gun Hill provides stunning panoramic views of the surrounding Himalayan peaks, including the magnificent snow-capped ranges of Bandarpunch, Srikantha, Pithwara, and Gangotri. Gun Hill is roughly 2,024 meters (6,640 feet) above sea level.

to 8 pm.

There is one Shanidev and hanuman temple, Maa Parvati devi temple on the hill.
If interested you can visit the gun hill at sun set. Otherwise nothing special. It is very disappointing for me to visit Gun hill, as nothing special in the place.

Don't miss this place when you are Mussorie!! The view from the top Is breathtaking ðŸ™Œ

places.generalDescription: Mall Rd in Shimla is a historic street dating back to the British colonial era, featuring an array of shops, malls, and cafes. The location offers stunning views, especially during the monsoon season when the valley is enveloped in mesmerizing clouds. While some find the prices a bit high due to the logistical challenges of bringing goods to this elevated area, visitors appreciate the clean rooms and washrooms. Nature lovers are drawn to Kasana Club for its serene ambiance and scenic swing.

sources.snippet: Mall Road, in the centre of Mussoorie, provides a multitude of options for pre-wedding photos. This busy promenade has it all, including vibrant street scenes, local markets, and colonial architecture. This famous street is the centre of the townâ€™s entertainment and shopping, and both residents and visitors have a special place in their hearts for it.

sources.snippet: The heart of Mussoorie, Mall Road, offers an array of possibilities for pre-wedding photography. This iconic thoroughfare is the town's main shopping and entertainment hub, and it holds a special place in the hearts of both tourists and locals.

places.generalDescription: Lal Tibba Scenic Point is a must-visit spot in Mussoorie, a popular hill station known for its religious sites and colonial heritage. Situated at an altitude of 6000ft, it offers breathtaking views of the Himalayas. The observation deck features a telescope on the roof of a modest cafe, providing visitors with an opportunity to marvel at the picturesque perspectives and lush green vegetation.

sources.snippet: The highest peak in Mussoorie, with an altitude of over 2,290 meters above sea level and provides some amazing and never seen before views of the mountains that house the holy shrines of Kedarnath and Badrinath. To give its visitors a clearer view of the picturesque surroundings a Japanese telescope has been installed at the edge of the cliff also the place is highly preserved from most commercial activities. reviews.text: I visited Lal Tibba and absolutely loved the experience! The view from the top was breathtaking, offering a clear glimpse of the snow-capped Himalayan peaks. The peaceful atmosphere and old-world charm made it even more special. A perfect spot to enjoy sunrise, nature, and spend quality time with family.

You can just about see the main ranges covered with snow on a clear day. Place is too crowded at sunset. Best option is to WALK from Chaardukan - do NOT drive and get stuck in jams at sunset. The walk is even better than the Scenic Point view. Too much traffic and food has cluttered an otherwise scenic spot.

Lal Tibba is supposed to have a great scenic view, but when I visited, it was mostly covered in fog, so I couldn't see much. It's a decent spot and might be great on a clear day, but my experience was just okay. It's worth visiting if you're nearby, but don't expect too much if the weather isn't clear.

places.name: Jharipani Waterfall

reviews.text: Jhadipani water fall is on jhadipani road it is just few meters away from the kamal cottages, if someone is going while going downhill to dehradun then the route for the waterfall will be on left-hand, but if someone is going uphill to mussorie then it will be on right hand side just opposite to jhadipani castle, so if you are on two wheelers then it is perfect for you to go there the route is somehow bumpy and somehow scary for some new riders try not to go with 4 Wheelers also you can walk but two wheelers can take you to nearby and don't try to push two wheelers to extreme ends because the route is risky and don't come in rainy season because there is a lot chance of landsliding and don't take children here as this route is somehow scary for them and risky too, also don't make the place dirty as it is a natural place i have seen a lot of plastic bottles of coldrinks and beer cans also broken Alcohol bottles don't spoil the beauty of the place

Beautiful nature at it's best, one of the least crowded place if you compare to other water falls. Almost 1.5 km trek to reach water fall, this place is also recommend to trek lover, it's a beautiful trek all the way to water fall with beautiful, lush green, science view.

Located in a secluded location about 7 km from Mussoorie, near Jharipani village, on the Dehradun-Mussoorie Road, Jharipani Falls is not very popular with the tourists. This is so because after reaching the starting point of hilly tract, one needs to trek 1.5 km to reach the waterfall. The trek is pleasant, quiet and peaceful. There are no eating joints enroute of near the falls. Well-known boarding schools like Oak Grove School and St. George's College are located near the Jharipani village.

places.generalDescription: Located in Mussoorie, the Soham Himalayan Centre is a serene museum that offers a glimpse into the rich culture and art of the Himalayas. This gem showcases a variety of artifacts, paintings, manuscripts, and photos that narrate the region's vibrant history and traditions. The tranquil sanctuary is nestled amidst the breathtaking mountains and provides a warm welcome to visitors. Run by a dedicated couple, this museum boasts an eclectic collection that has been lovingly curated over 11 years.

sources.snippet: 1 km from city center 21 out of 34 Places To Visit in Mussoorie. Located on the Chamunda Peeth Temple Road in Mussoorie, Soham Heritage Centre is a private enterprise preserving the rich Himalayan heritage by showcasing the cultural diversity of the Himalayas through paintings, murals, scrap art, frescoes and artefacts. Established in January 2014, the Soham Heritage & Art Centre is the result of around 18 years of tireless planning, inspiration, dedication and collecting of data.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to visit in Mussoorie | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: SOHAM Himalayan Centre

reviews.text:
A perfect amalgamation of heritage and art topped with creativity.
Founder couple are awesome ,their depth of knowledge and hospitality mesmerised us.
A must visit place.
The scenic beauty of mussoorie from the coffee table place is the best to watch.
Overall it's a gemspot

It's a nice  museum ....
The entry fee is 100 per person.
which has good collection of artefacts...
Park the car or bike on main road as there is narrow and steep road to museum which is difficult to ride...

It is a good place to understand the culture and society of Uttarakhand. It includes dresses, ornaments, pillars, housing styles, musical instruments  and hand written scripts. These things are preserved so well. Additionally the esthetics of the campus is great.

places.address: Chamunda Peeth Temple Road, Big Bend Bala Hisar, Mussoorie, Uttarakhand 248179, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the mountains, Jabarkhet Nature Reserve is a private forest sanctuary offering wildlife viewing and hiking trails. The reserve spans over 100 acres of land on the Mussoorie-Dhanaulti road, approximately 15 km from the city center. Set at an elevation of around 2000 meters above sea level, it features diverse altitudinal zones with rare plants, insects, reptiles, animals, trees, birds and mammals.

sources.snippet: 4 km from city center 27 out of 34 Places To Visit in Mussoorie. Jabarkhet Wildlife Reserve boasts of being the first privately owned and operated wildlife sanctuary in Uttarakhand, which is also the first of its kind in all of India. Located on the Mussoorie- Dhanaulti road, around 15 kms from the heart of the city, the nature park is spread over 100 acres of land.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to visit in Mussoorie | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Jabarkhet Wildlife Reserve is a great opportunity for you to walk through nature with marked hiking trails while having sights of birds along with their melodious song. This walk through the woods of deodar and cedar with the scent of it in the air is very refreshing. It is the perfect getaway if you like to get close to nature.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Mussoorie: Photos, Timings & Highlights

places.name: Jabarkhet Nature Reserve, Mussorie

reviews.text: What a natural experience. It is a nature reserve with various trails you can go hike on. Quite adventurous and fun for nature lovers. Go in a group to make the most of it. You can explore  and enjoy the beauty of each trail. You have to buy tickets for entering the reserve as it is privately own property.  But a must visit place whenever in Mussoorie for a calm hike.

This is very quiet and peaceful place, i went there for a solo trek and felt very safe and in the lap of nature. There are different types of  flowers, trees and glasses throughout, and the trek is well defined with sign boards at every step. I could hear the sound of birds and insects throughout, there are places in between where one can meditate for hours.
Lovely hiking area. Well marked. You can hire a guide or use their very detailed map as a guide.

places.address: Nature Reserve, Jabarkhet, Landour, Mussoorie, Uttarakhand 248179, India

places.generalDescription: Christ Church is a striking 19th-century church in Mussoorie, believed to be the oldest in the Himalayan range. Its Gothic architecture and beautiful stained-glass windows make it an iconic landmark in the town, reflecting its colonial past. Constructed in 1836 by British officers and visitors as their place of worship, it gained further prominence when visited by the Princess of Wales in 1906.

sources.snippet: The oldest Catholic church in the Himalayan region, Christ Church is located around 600 metres from Library Bus Stand in Mussoorie. Standing as reminiscent of the pre-independence British era, Christ Church is an epitome of eye-catching gothic-style architecture. Established in 1836 by the private donations of Britishers, who used to live in Mussoorie, the church features the happenings in the life of Jesus Christ on its windows and altar.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Places to Visit in Mussoorie

sources.snippet: Boasting of being one of the first churches to be built in Himalayan region, the Christ Church was established in 1836. Situated on a hill above the Kasmanda Palace, Mussoorie Christ Church is built in the style of Gothic architecture, displaying pre-Raphaelite glass windows, pointed arches and ribbed vaults. The pipe organ, William Hill Organ, installed in 1911 is its major attraction.
sources.shortName: 20 Incredible Tourist Places to Visit in Mussoorie

sources.snippet: Christ church was built in 1836 and is considered to be the oldest churches in the Himalayan ranges by the British during the British colonization in India. Possessing Gothic design and architectural styles, the stained glass windows in the Church represent the events in the life of Jesus Christ. Apart from this, the high altar in the Church presents the sufferings of Jesus Christ.
sources.shortName: 10 Places To Visit In Mussoorie

sources.snippet: 1 km from city center 7 out of 34 Places To Visit in Mussoorie. Situated on little hill-lock slightly above the Kasmanda Palace, Mussoorie Christ Church boasts of being the very first Catholic church in all of the Himalayan region. Built in 1836, the exquisite church is an exemplary example of Gothic architecture which evolved from Romanesque architecture.

One the oldest church in the city
Come here get knowledge of old place and get good information about the our old historical places

it was earlier known as Lord's Church. The church has eight exquisite pre-Raphaelite and Victorian stained-glass windows and a rare historic William Hill organ, which was bought to the church in the 1880. Near the church is a deodar tree planted by HRH the princess of Wales in March 1906 after attending the morning service at the Church and a bible dating from 1889 kept on an exquisite stand which is dismountable in six parts.

An old piece of history, so lost to time that even the locals can't tell it's location. It was a bit hard to find, with Google giving intractable paths. Couldn't see the stained glass windows inside as the Church opens only on Sundays. What a site it must have been in the colonial times, looking over the valley from the mall road

places.generalDescription: K Dev Bhoomi Wax Museum, located in the picturesque Company Garden at Mussoorie, is a charming attraction that showcases around 25 to 26 lifelike wax statues of renowned personalities from India and across the globe. Inspired by Madame Tussauds, this museum offers visitors the chance to admire well-crafted wax figures of iconic figures such as Mahatma Gandhi, Mother Teresa, Michael Jackson, and more.

sources.snippet: Why travel all the way to Madame Tussauds in order to see wax statues of famous personalities when you can do it at a much lesser cost by visiting Mussoorie?. K Dev Bhoomi Wax Museum, which was inaugurated in 2015, takes its inspiration from Madame Tussauds and hosts roughly 25 wax statues of famous people from all over the world. The statutes are well-made and decent in quality as compared to their wax counterparts around the Tussauds museums.The museum is located in the popular Company Garden at Mussoorie and is a small one, so you will be able to visit it within 30 minutes.
sources.shortName: 35 Best Places to Visit in Mussoorie: Photos, Timings & Highlights

sources.snippet: 2 km from city center 29 out of 34 Places To Visit in Mussoorie. Another feather in the cap of Mussoorie is the newly inaugurated K Dev Bhoomi Wax Museum, inspired by Madame Tussauds in London. Situated in the premises of Company Garden, just 3 kms ahead of The Mall, the museum boasts of lifelike wax statues of both domestic and international personalities.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to visit in Mussoorie | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Taking cues from the world renowned Madame Tussauds Museum in London, Mussoorie has opened its own wax museum that displays lifelike wax figures of famous personalities of India and abroad. The wax museum is another...

places.name: K Dev Bhoomi Wax Museum

reviews.text: Good place but number of Wax statues are very few so Rs.100 for visiting Wax Museum is bit high. Also beware of ticketing staff of wax museum

Dev Bhumi Wax Museum is a popular tourist attraction located in Mussoorie, near the Company Garden. It features life-size wax statues of famous personalities from India and around the world, similar to Madame Tussauds.

Key Highlights:

Statues of Celebrities: Includes figures of Bollywood actors, freedom fighters, sports legends, and global icons.

Great Photo Opportunity: Visitors can click pictures with their favorite personalities.

Location: Near Company Garden, about 3 km from Mall Road, Mussoorie.

Entry Fee: Usually ranges between â‚¹100â€“â‚¹150 per person (subject to change).

I'm not someone who's deeply into wax museums or a big fan of wax art, but I still expected at least some of that â€œwait, is that real?â€ moment people often talk about. Unfortunately, it just never happened.

I do appreciate the effort that went into setting up the space and creating the models, but the experience was underwhelming. At â‚¹100 per person, and with four of us visiting, it honestly felt like a bit of a waste.

A lot of the figures didn't look very realistic. They lacked the detail and finish you'd usually expect. Some of them looked quite fake, which really took away from the overall experience.

There was also a strange emphasis on Western pop celebrities. While that's not necessarily bad, I did expect to see more Indian figures, especially considering the location. A better balance would have made the visit more meaningful and memorable.

All in all, it's a decent attempt, but it just didn't have the impact or excitement we were hoping for.

places.address: F362+JG9, Company garden,, Mussoorie, Uttarakhand, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the lush greenery of Mussoorie, Mossy Falls is a serene natural attraction located about 7 kilometers from the city. The waterfall derives its name from the abundant algae-covered rocks surrounding it. Cascading from a height of approximately 145 meters, Mossy Falls is divided into six parts, creating a picturesque sight that requires some walking to fully appreciate.

sources.snippet: One of the most beautiful places to visit in Mussoorie, Mossy Falls is located in the middle of a green forest. The falls are 145 meters high and have falls at different levels: 20 feet, 17 feet, 19 feet, 12 feet, and 57 feet. The falls are about 7 km from Mussoorie and, if you visit early enough, you will probably be amongst the few to enjoy the waterfall in its peaceful environment.
sources.shortName: 20 best places to visit in Mussoorie - Uttarakhand

sources.snippet: Named for its mossy outgrowth in the surroundings, Mossy Fall is the best place to visit for couples in Mussoorie. A solitary place, offering pleasant vibes, Mossy Fall is located far away from the chaos of the city, perched in the lush green hills. Besides being a hotspot for couples, it is also a popular place for trekkers and photographers because of its rich landscapes of nature.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Places to Visit in Mussoorie

sources.snippet: 3 km from city center 20 out of 34 Places To Visit in Mussoorie. Cosily tucked amidst the tantalizing mountains and the exuberant woods, Mossy Falls is a well-kept secret of the hill town of Mussoorie. Located at a distance of 7 kms from the main city on the Bala Hisar Road, the mesmerising cascade Falls is named after the moss-laden rocks surrounding the gushing waterfalls.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to visit in Mussoorie | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Mossy Falls is one of the unexplored and prettiest places to visit in Mussoorie. Facing a jungle on one side, this place is the ideal getaway for a quiet day out. The falls is nestled cosily amidst the woods and lives like a secret place in Mussorie that many do not discover instantaneously.
sources.shortName: 14 Places to Visit in Mussoorie in 2022 | Tourist Attractions in Mussoorie

sources.snippet: It is situated at a distance of 7 kms from the main city on the Bala Hisar Road . It has a beauteous and scenic view which will be the suitable background for the pre wedding shoot . You must go there as it will be perfect when water will fall down on the lush green ground and stones .

sources.snippet: A waterfall that is tucked in the middle of dark green, almost fairytale-like forest. Thick milky mist rises from the pool at the bottom of this 145 m fall as the sharp wet smell of greens permeates the air. To see this beauty you will have to work hard and hike up a meandering way.
sources.shortName: Tourist Places To Visit In Mussoorie (2025)

sources.snippet: Surround yourself with nature, water, and mountains at Mossy Falls. This is a relatively lesser explored waterfall in Mussoorie, and that is its USP over the Kempty Falls. Due to its lush green surroundings, the chirping of birds is best enjoyed.

reviews.text: A awesome natural fall at Barlow gunj, Mussoorie..its an beautiful fall with a little bit of tracking involved..There is a temple of lord shiva also which gets water from natural fall..quite an magical place..

Very offbeat location, steep downhill winding path. Drivers and motorists beware! It can be very slippery in the rain.
Can't say how clean the water is, nearby residents use the same water for water supply so must be clean to some extent.
The location is peaceful and a small beautiful temple is nearby.
Another trek leads all the way to Shikhar fall and Sahastradhara also, which is not so steep and there are some hamlets on the way.
It's a seasonal fall the water flow is less in summers and non season. But it's peaceful, if looking for serenity definitely a must visit place.

places.generalDescription: Kellogg Memorial Church, a Presbyterian church built in 1903, holds historical significance as it played a role in Britishers learning Hindi to rule over Indians. Named after Dr. Samuel H Kellogg, an American missionary who contributed to the development of Mussoorie, this brownstone edifice showcases stunning Gothic architecture and is located near Kasmanda Palace in Landour, Uttarakhand. The church's beautiful stained glass windows and peaceful surroundings make it a popular tourist attraction in Mussoorie.

sources.snippet: The Church was built as a Presbyterian church in 1903 and was also the home of the Landour Language School where British people were taught Hindi at that time. The church was named for Rev, Dr. Samuel H. Kellogg (1839-1899), an American Presbyterian missionary active in Landour who wrote a book on Grammar of Hindi in English. The Language school is still being run today known as the Landour Language School.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Places to Visit in Mussoorie, Things to Do & Sightseeing (2024)

sources.snippet: 2 km from city center 6 out of 34 Places To Visit in Mussoorie. The Kellogg Memorial Church is a Presbyterian church that is located close to the Kasmanda Palace in the small army cantonment of Landour in Mussoorie, Uttarakhand. It is widely admired for its spectacular architecture and historical significance.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to visit in Mussoorie | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Kellogg Memorial Church is a Presbyterian church, built-in 1903. It is amongst the historic architecture that stands tall for a long time. Not to forget that it is a good depiction of the Presbyterian style of architecture as well as the Gothic style with a number of glass stained windows.

places.name: Kellogg Memorial Church

reviews.text:
Kellogg Memorial Church is a stunning piece of history nestled in the heart of Landour. The neo-Gothic architecture, with its beautiful stained glass windows and pointed arches, is truly captivating. The church holds historical significance as the place where Hindi was first taught to missionaries.

Surrounded by towering deodar trees, the church offers a peaceful ambiance, making it a perfect spot for those exploring Landour's colonial charm. However, visitors should note that the church premises are only open to tourists during the Sunday mass. If you happen to be in Landour on a Sunday, attending the service is a great way to experience the church's spiritual and architectural beauty up close.

A must-visit for history lovers, architecture enthusiasts, and anyone seeking a quiet retreat in the hills!
Must visit place in Mussoorie. Walk around the church is very good. Its worth all the hype about Landour. Its calm and silent circular roads will make your Mussoorie visit complete.

Kellogg Memorial Church blends old-world charm with tranquil surroundings. Set amidst tall deodar trees, its grey stone walls and green accents evoke a peaceful colonial-era aura. A must-visit for those who appreciate quiet heritage sites.

places.generalDescription: Benog Wildlife Sanctuary, located within Rajaji National Park, is a popular tourist destination in Mussoorie. While the sanctuary is home to various rare and common fauna like the Himalayan goat, panther, leopard, deer, and bear, it's particularly known for birdwatching and trekking. The easy trek passes through jungle, mines, valleys, and hills with no shops along the way. Visitors are advised to hire a guide for safety.

sources.snippet: Pre-wedding pictures are made extra special by dense forests, a variety of plants and animals, and the excitement of a jungle setting. This protected area offers a unique fusion of wildlife and natural beauty, making it the perfect setting for capturing the special moments before your wedding. Benog Wildlife Sanctuary is a great location for an outdoor pre-wedding photo shoot because of its tranquil atmosphere, meandering forest trails, and colorful rhododendron blooms.
sources.shortName: 10+ Places For Pre-Wedding Photoshoot In Mussoorie Which Are Mesmerizing

sources.snippet: 6 km from city center 10 out of 34 Places To Visit in Mussoorie. Famous for its almost-extinct mountain quails, deer, leopards and red-billed blue magpie, the Benog Wildlife Sanctuary is well known to house rare species of birds and offers an excellent trail of pine-clad slopes surrounded by Himalayan peaks for a refreshing walk. It is an ideal site for bird watching and capturing gorgeous views of the surrounding Chaukhamba and Bandarpunch Peaks.
sources.shortName: 34 Best Places to visit in Mussoorie | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: For couples who relish the charm of the wild, Benog Wildlife Sanctuary is the perfect location. Dense forests, diverse flora and fauna, and the thrill of a jungle backdrop create unique pre-wedding photos. This protected area offers a distinctive blend of natural beauty and wildlife, providing an enchanting backdrop for capturing the romantic moments leading up to your wedding.

sources.snippet: Located at a distance of 11 km from the Mall Road, Benog Wildlife Sanctuary is a must visit for every wildlife enthusiast. Spread over an area of more than 330 hectares, this sanctuary is home to mountain quails, leopards, red-billed blue magpie, deer and many rare species of birds. With Pine and Cedar trees all around, this place is exceptionally scenic too.

places.name: Benog Wildlife Sanctuary

reviews.text: This Sanctuary is located in Mussoorie (around 10 km from the main library chowk). Entry fee of 200 is charged to enter the park. Early Morning visits are the best to locate different bird species. Recently, a bird watching festival was organised by the government here. One can trek to the cloud end from this gate which is located around 10 km from entry point.

Entry ticket 200. It is surrounded by the benedictory pines, old cedar trees, and medicinal plants that grow in abundance in this area. The sanctuary has developed as a bird watching haven and is a home to a wide variety of birds. The trek passes through the jungle, mines, valleys and hills. peacefu, quiet and pretty.

Heaven fir natural lovers . It's a wonderful sanctuary largely untouched by humans. It's 2.5 km from main road off road track best by bike then car. Entry ticket 200 rupee for Indians , it's advisable to park your vehicle at entry gate as the path in sanctuary is not conductive for vehicles. Take your own water and food while trekking . Better to take a stick to ward of reptiles and animals . Some resorts are there near its entry gate
